metadata.title: CVE-2022-0185 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description: A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way thelegacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of theLinux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (incase of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespacedCAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does notsupport the Filesystem Context API (and thus fallbacks to legacy handling)could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
